description:
Running devstack K, trying to get the notification from nova.api, especially the instance update.

Enabled in config:
[DEFAULT]
notification_driver=nova.openstack.common.notifier.rpc_notifier
notification_topics=notifications,monitor
notify_on_state_change=vm_and_task_state
notify_on_any_change=True
instance_usage_audit=True
instance_usage_audit_period=hour

I can see some notifications coming (rabbitmqctl list_queues | grep notifications.info), but when i rename an instance (which calls into servers.py - update) i don't see the message count increasing, meaning the message is not being sent to rabbitmq.

I can see the action being called:
2015-04-02 15:12:23.738 DEBUG nova.api.openstack.wsgi [req-b8fc8e5e-c339-4329-9f01-3d6e57d2f14b admin admin] Action: 'update', calling method: <bound method Controller.update of <nova.api.openstack.compute.servers.Controller object at 0x7f9e9c382190>>, body: {"server": {"name": "instance3"}}  but i don't see the notification.

Related: https://ask.openstack.org/en/question/62331/how-to-receive-nova-notification-computeinstanceupdate/

comments.content:
A server rename isn't a state change that would emit a notification (it doesn't change the task or vm state).

I don't see any 'notify_on_any_change' in the code base.

So I think this is working as designed. Is there a specific reason that you are looking for notifications on rename?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~sdague

comments.content:
Thanks Sean, i thought this was the case, just wanted to be sure i'm not doing something wrong.

As for the reason, we have a storage solution which needs to show both the volume name and instance name, and we want to integrate it with OpenStack; the problem now is that if you rename an instance in OpenStack, our GUI will show the old name (actually the xml file name, which doesn't change), so i would like to catch that rename and be able to show the name.

But we'll think of something else.
